CARDINAL . When the applicant arrived , the school grounds were filled with a group of mostly young women , who were singing . The applicant stood near a water tank . She noticed the presence of ORG soldiers and NORP policemen armed with batons .

CARDINAL . The ORG officers invited the demonstrators to leave the LOC . However , within TIME , the NORP policemen had rushed towards them . CARDINAL . The Government alleged that the applicant had participated in a violent demonstration with the aim of inflaming anti - NORP sentiment . The demonstrators , supported by the NORP - Cypriot administration , were demanding that the “ GPE ” in GPE should be dismantled . Some carried NORP flags , clubs , knives and wire - cutters . They were acting in a provocative manner and shouting abuse . The demonstrators were warned in NORP and LANGUAGE that unless they dispersed they would be arrested in accordance with the laws of the “ GPE ” . The applicant was arrested by the NORP - NORP police after crossing the ORG buffer zone and entering the area under NORP - Cypriot control . The NORP - NORP police intervened in the face of the manifest inability of the NORP - Cypriot authorities and ORG in GPE to contain the incursion and its possible consequences .

CARDINAL . No force was used against demonstrators who did not intrude into the “ GPE ” border area and , in the case of demonstrators who were arrested for violating the border , no more force was used than was reasonably necessary in the circumstances in order to arrest and detain the persons concerned . No one was ill - treated . It was possible that some of the demonstrators had hurt themselves in the confusion or in attempting to scale barbed wire or other fencing . Had the NORP police , or anyone else , assaulted or beaten any of the demonstrators , the ORG Secretary General would no doubt have referred to this in his report to ORG .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW reads as follows :

“ Where CARDINAL or more persons assemble with intent to commit an offence , or , being assembled with intent to carry out some common purpose , conduct themselves in such a manner as to cause persons in the neighbourhood to fear that the persons so assembled will commit a breach of the peace , or will by such assembly needlessly and without any reasonable occasion provoke other persons to commit a breach of the peace they are an unlawful assembly .
It is immaterial that the original assembly was lawful if , being assembled , they conduct themselves with a common purpose in such a manner as aforesaid .

When an unlawful assembly has begun to execute the purpose , whether of a public or of a private nature , for which it assembled by a breach of the peace and to the terror of the public , the assembly is called a riot , and the persons assembled are said to be riotously assembled . ”
CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of LAW , any person who takes part in an unlawful assembly is guilty of a misdemeanour and liable to imprisonment for DATE .
